A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Spoilers ahead. Could've benefited from a more concise story. The Luke scenes were fantastic\, but Rey hardly developed past what we knew about her in Force Awakens. The Last Jedi seems to have very intentionally reversed key plot points from Force Awakens. Instead of revealing who Snoke is\, he's killed off in a ridiculous scene. We're now told Rey's parents are \"nobodies\"\, after being teased about her parentage throughout the first film. In the first film\, the central plan was to seek out Luke Skywalker. He dies here\, contributing little. This film subtracts key storylines and adds virtually nothing.
